Entries.Follow-up: Smoking tobacco contributes to various types of disease (including cancer, heart disease, diabetes, kidney failure, and more). It's never too late to quit smoking. Please consult our doctor on methods of smoking cessation.

WHO recommends that men do not drink more than 21 units of alcohol per week. (1 unit of alcohol is equivalent to 218ml of 4.5% cider, 76ml of 1.3% wine, 25ml of 40% whiskey, 250ml of 4% beer and/or 250ml of 4% alcopop).

WHO recommends that women do not drink more than 14 units of alcohol per week. (1 unit of alcohol is equivalent to 218ml of 4.5% cider, 76ml of 1.3% wine, 25ml of 40% whiskey, 250ml of 4% beer and/or 250ml of 4% alcopop).

Entries.Cut-off: Yes but < 150 mins and Yes but empty mins
Entries.Follow-up: WHO recommends regular exercising at least 150 mins of moderate-intensity physical activity per week (e.g. brisk walking, cycling, and swimming). Exercise can help lower the risk of developing disease such as obesity, diabetes, and/or raised blood pressure.
